alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 05 at 2:31AM PST until March 05 at 10:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Sierra Slopes. * WHEN...Through 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will be capable of blowing down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages may result. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusts in the Sierra have gusted up to 60 mph so far this morning. With recently warm temperatures, locations in the Sierra may be seeing increased recreational use. These winds may catch any hikers or climbers off guard. These downslope winds may also descend all the way to Highway 395 corridor at times, causing blow overs for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County
